explanation: To determine if print_perf_warnings violates the MISRA rule banning direct or indirect self-calls, you must inspect every function it calls (and those functions’ callees) to see if any path returns to print_perf_warnings. The only direct callee in the static call graph is MHD_is_feature_supported, so its implementation (and any functions it calls) must be analyzed to detect any indirect recursion back to print_perf_warnings. Other listed functions (e.g. run_mhd and its callees) are callers of print_perf_warnings, not callees, and therefore cannot create a recursion path that starts from print_perf_warnings.
